instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2532: What is 820-2532? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.C7771: What is C7771? Tantalum capacitor on 820-2330 and 820-2532 logic boards that often dies and causes PP1V05_S5_MCP or PP1V05_S5 to be 0.331v instead of 1.05v. If heating this cap restores voltage to this rail, replace.
definitions.U7100: What is U7100? U7100 refers to the ISL6259 or ISL9239 charging IC on Macbooks from 2013 to the present.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2532</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>  No boot
threads.message:
I have an issue with this board.
<TRANSISTOR>Q7102</TRANSISTOR> & F7040 is burn, i change it now I have F7040 and remove <TRANSISTOR>Q7102</TRANSISTOR> but i haven't this component.
<TRANSISTOR>Q7102</TRANSISTOR> is it necessary to boot? because when i short power pad, fan don't spin or another dead component, <CAPACITOR>C7771</CAPACITOR> = 1.05V
No liquid on board.
thanks

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2532</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>  No boot
threads.message: <TRANSISTOR>Q7102</TRANSISTOR> probably already killed the CPU. Need to replace <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> and <TRANSISTOR>Q7102</TRANSISTOR> at a minimum first.
